text:
Hello everyone.

How can I filter records using crm_objects(dynamic_page_crm_object_type_fqn) ?
I found this crm_objects(dynamic_page_crm_object_type_fqn, "property_type=something") but now I need filter by multiple values

for example I need filter by country where country in USA, Armenia etc..
What about when you preview for a contact?
Anyone knows the private app is creating or not in developer test account? I can not able to create private app
I'm just trying to figure out the share code for Instagram and can't seem to find it
Yeah I noticed that rich text properties with URLs are automatically clickable (on the left-hand bar), so I don't have an issue on the object record page.

Hi all - I have CRM objects partitioned by Teams that need to be displayed on a page assigned to those teams. Object visibility is limited to “Team Only” in permission sets. When i use `crm_objects()` , the query retrieves all records that meet the criteria, regardless of team partitioning. If the team was available in Hubl, I could add `HubSpot_team_id` to the query. Anyone know how to retrieve the team that owns a website page?
Does anyone else have an issue with the "copy to HubL" function where it doesn't always work?
Yep. I've noticed any modules that are on the template by default, that when is doesnt work. If you add them from the sidebar it seems to work
ah, thank you for this insight!
Joe - was able to get this solved!
using `&zip_code="~contact.zip` and doing the limit before it

I think it's the same question when I want to do this with color.

how do I use `{{ module.style.color_field.color }}` in my module.css or html so it ultimately renders?

take each of those fields and `|pprint` them
```{{ module.style.textalignment_field|pprint }}
{{ module.style.color_field.color|pprint }}```
and you’ll see how to use them

`(SizeLimitingPyMap: {css=})`

is how this renders? I am using the HubSpot web UI to try to modify some modules. I'm not CLI

when I use the module and set alignment to Centered, I get the list I mentioned above (it's not quite a list or a dict really, assuming this is an intermediary form used by hubL)
`{text_align=CENTER, css=text-align: CENTER }`

That would make sense!

Ok, I put this in my module.css
and it doesn't render. I'm looking at inspector. I added this reeeediculous border just to be sure my css targeting is accurate. I set alignment to center using the styles tab in the WYSIWYG editor.

:crying_cat_face:

hey wow it suddenly worked!
idk what changed but hurray!
Thanks for showing me the general idea, even if it was failing due to unknown other gremlins of my own creation <@U3T21PDBK>

Yeah man. If you need any additional help with hubl and modules, I’d take a look at <https://youtu.be/WlfqIPlH1ZA|this youtube video on the HubSpot dev channel>. It is geared towards WP devs but it has style fields in there as well as some best practices

I also tried this but the same posts pop up, which are unrelated:

```{% related_blog_posts limit=3, no_wrapper=True, post_formatter="recent_post", tags=current_post_tags %}```

Great video, thanks!

I'm so used to putting all CSS in the css file, I missed
> In general, `module.css` supports a very limited subset of HubL
I think my answer requires a close reading of
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/files#styling-based-on-module-field-values>
Hi Evelynn! Thanks for this, I'll test it out!

Yes that's a great idea to use the dnd_section. And <@U01K4P1RWHW>  if you are sure that you are going to use form in the 2nd section all the time , then go with the negative margin or Transform/Translate .
